archdesc.runner: Digital Library and Archives, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Digital Library and Archives, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University, Blacksburg, Va.
did.unittitle: Steven and Cathi House Architectural Collection, 1992-2002
did.abstract: Steven and Cathi House are Virginia Tech alumnae and award winning architects. Their firm House + House is located in San Francisco, California. This collection includes materials about six residential projects located in California and Florida.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Permission to publish material from the Steven and Cathi House Architectural Collection must be obtained from the Digital Library and Archives, Virginia Tech.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: Steven and Cathi House Architectural Collection, Ms2006-017, Digital Library and Archives, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University, Blacksburg, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The Steven and Cathi House Architectural Collection was donated to the International Archive of Women in Architecture at the Digital Library and Archives by its creators in 2005. An addition to the collection was donated in 2007.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The arrangement and description of the Steven and Cathi House Architectural Collection took place in August 2006. The finding aid was updated to reflect the collection addition in 2007.

bioghist.head: Biographical Information
bioghist.p: Steven and Cathi House are alumnae of the Virginia Tech School of Architecture. In 1982 they opened their own firm, House + House Architects, in San Francisco, California. They have completed a variety of award-winning projects throughout the United States and the Caribbean.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of information about six projects, five in California and one in Florida. The material about each project includes construction documents, and some also have related color photographs of the finished project and written project descriptions. The collection is arranged chronologically by project date. Additional project materials are expected in the future.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged by chronologically by project, and divided by type of material. Sets of construction documents are stored in oversized folders.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Material
separatedmaterial.p: The following items were transferred to the Special Collections Rare Book room:
House, Steven and Cathi House. Mediterranean Village: an architectural journey. Australia: Images Publishing Group, 2004.
House, Steven and Cathi House. House+House: Choreographing Space: House Design. Australia: Images Publishing Group, 1999.

did.unittitle: De Piazza Paz Residence, Saint Augustine, Florida, 1999
